attributes.comment:
We are in the end stages of our first adoption and our first child, a little
girl from Guatemala. International adoption is expensive, given fees and monies
for processing here in the U.S. as well as the processing in the country of our
child's birth. For us, the process has taken much longer than normal. This has
already meant extra fees be paid to CIS for a second set of fingerprints because
they expired, as well as the fee for an expired I-600a. While we understand
labor costs for CIS would increase periodically, these increases proposed seem
excessive. We would ask for a much more modest increase in CIS fees, given the
many devoted American families who are trying to bring a child into their homes.
We hope that our little girl can have a little sister and would like to make
that dream a reality too, without the barriers of excessive costs. Thank you
for listening and your consideration.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anonymous
